definition: to hold a pass/to guard (a strategic location)
to grip forcefully/to clutch at/to guard/to control/to hold
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: All the approaches to the palace were guarded by troops.
sentences.chinese: 通往宫殿的一切路途都有队伍扼守。

sentences.english: Mte guardian of the Yangtze River by the throat, has always been contested.
sentences.chinese: 焦山扼守着长江的咽喉，自古是兵家必争之地。

sentences.english: The soldiers held the mountain pass and beat back the intruders.
sentences.chinese: 战士们扼守住山口，打退了敌人的进犯。

definition: to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to grip forcefully/to clutch at/to guard/to control/to hold
strategically situated and easy to defend/strategic location
to rely on natural barriers (for one's defense)
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
